meaning_str.bing:
n. 支出
v. “spend”的现在分词
网络. 消费；花费；经费

花费；用；度过；花（时间）；消耗；用尽；（spend的现在分词）

1.en: But in the run-up to the mid-terms, the Democrats ought to have had one example of spending at its best: investment in infrastructure.
1.cn: 但是为准备中期选举，民主党人应该举出他们做得最好的一笔花费：基础设施建设投资。

2.en: What if I told you that you could write that free ebook in just one week, spending no more than two hours per day on it?
2.cn: 那么如果我告诉你，你可以在一周内写完一本免费电子书，并且每天在这上面只要花不超过两个小时呢？

3.en: Sometimes a business might be better off spending a quarter or a year not growing but simply consolidating existing business.
3.cn: 有时候，用一个季度或一年的时间巩固现有业务，这比扩张对企业更有意义。

0.en: When you say it in that tone, it implies that Luke and I haven't been spending quality time together. Which we have.
0.cn: 你用这种语气说出来，表明卢克和我没有好好共度父子亲密时光，其实是有的。

1.en: It means I'm spending more than an hour just preparing to enter the factory. But nothing can really prepare me for what I find inside.
1.cn: 为了准备进这家公司，我不止要花一个小时了，但是你在里面遇到的事，什么准备都是没有用的。

2.en: Well, if anyone's interested, I'll be spending this Valentine's Day the same way I spend every Valentine's Day. Buying a rotisserie chicken from the supermarket, taking it home, standing over the sink and eating it out of the package with my bare hands like an animal.
2.cn: 呃，如果任何人有兴趣，今年的情人节我会像往年一样，从超市买只大烤鸡带回家，站在洗手池边像只禽兽一样直接打开包装用手抓着吃。

3.en: Well, tomorrow's Saturday. Saturday night is laundry night. So I'll be spending the preevning pre-sorting and pre-soaking.
3.cn: 明天是周六，周六晚是洗衣夜，所以傍晚我会用来预分选衣物，并预浸湿。

4.en: Yeah, well, my quality father-son time was spending my adolescence looking out the window waiting for my dad to come back someday.
4.cn: 我小时候美好的父子时光都用来盯着窗外，等我爸会不会回心转意回家来了。

5.en: There's just only so much time and energy in a single day, and I think we need to constantly be asking ourselves, "Am I spending it as wisely as I can?"
5.cn: 只是一天的时间和精力有限，我觉得我们该不断自省，“我是否尽可能明智地利用我的时间和精力了？”

6.en: Well, let's go 2-D. No sense in spending extra money.
6.cn: 那就看2D场吧。没必要多花钱。

7.en: And what else are we spending five bob on? What else are we spending six pence on?
7.cn: 我们在哪儿花过5先令? 还是在哪儿花过6便士?

8.en: Until I met you, I couldn't imagine spending my life with just one person and now I can't imagine spending one day of it without you.
8.cn: 遇到你之前，一生一爱，共度一生对我如同天方夜谭，而现在，分离一刻便有如生离死别。

9.en: Yeah, we ended up spending the day together and had such a great time.
9.cn: 我们整天泡在一起，玩得很开心

10.en: I mean, there's no point in spending time with someone if it's just fun.
10.cn: 如果只是为了好玩，我们就不必交往了。

11.en: Spending all night talking to a woman who wasn't even there. Oh, shut up, you!
11.cn: 整晚对着一个不存在的女人说话。你闭嘴！

12.en: If you wanted me to stay out later, you should've given me more spending money.
12.cn: 如果你想让我晚点回家，就应该给我多点零花钱啊。

13.en: Well, once, when I was 15, spending the summer at the Heidelberg institute in Germany.
13.cn: 有一次，我15岁暑假的时候在德国的海德尔堡学院。

14.en: We're supposed to be spending a romantic weekend together, what is the matter with you?
14.cn: 我们出来是为了过浪漫周末，你到底哪里有毛病？

15.en: Well, I guess with you doing the internship, we're spending more than we're bringing in.
15.cn: 因为你在做实习工作,我们花的比赚的还多。

16.en: Yeah, well, I've been dreaming about spending Valentine's Day with a girl since I was six.
16.cn: 是吗？那我还从六岁起就梦想有朝一日有个女生能与我共度情人节呢。

17.en: Look, you guys I just wanna say, I really really appreciate you spending this time with me.
17.cn: 真的很谢谢你们来陪我。

18.en: It's just sometimes I feel like you enjoy spending time with your friends more than with me.
18.cn: 只是有时候我觉得你更愿意和朋友在一起玩，而不是我。

19.en: We regret to inform you that you will be spending the next four years in New York with Maya.
19.cn: 我们遗憾地通知你接下来的4年你将和玛雅一起在纽约度过！
